source_sentence: 例品第四(有十一經)(第五後誦)　一切智、法嚴　　鞞訶、第一得　愛生、及八城　　阿那律陀二　諸見、箭與喻　　比例最在後（二一二）中阿含例品一切智經第一我聞如是：一時，佛遊欝頭隨若，在普棘刺林。
translation: Exemplar 4 (with 11 sūtras) (recited after the fifth) Yiqie zhiyi, fayan, vaiha, the first attainment, aspiration, and the eight cities, aniruddha, two views, arrows, and metaphors, and the most proportions that follow (2:12) 中阿含例品一切智經第一 我 听说这样这样：One time, the Buddha traveled to Uddaka and was in the Prickly Thorn Forest.

source_sentence: 爾時，拘薩羅王波斯匿，聞沙門瞿曇遊欝頭隨若，在普棘刺林，拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，告一人曰：「汝往詣沙門瞿曇所，為我問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？
translation: It was then that the king of Kośala Prasenajit heard that the ascetic Gautama had traveled to Uddaka and was in the Prickly Thorn Forest. After hearing this, the king of Kośala Prasenajit told one of the men, "Would you go to the ascetic Gautama and inquire for me about the health and strength of the sages, their comfort and well-being, their freedom from illness, the ease with which they get up and go about their business, and their strength as usual?

source_sentence: 作如是語：『拘薩羅王波斯匿問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』
translation: He said, 'Did the king of Kośala Prasenajit ask about the health and strength of the sages, their well-being and freedom from illness, their ease of rising and standing, and their strength as usual?'

source_sentence: 又復語曰：『拘薩羅王波斯匿欲來相見。』」
translation: He also said, 'The king of Kośala Prasenajit wants to come and see you.'"

source_sentence: 彼人受教，往詣佛所，共相問訊，却坐一面，白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: They were instructed, went to the Buddha, exchanged greetings with him, withdrew to sit to one side, and said, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？
translation: Did the king of Kośala Prasenajit ask if the sage's body was strong and healthy, that he was comfortable and free of illness, that he could get up and down easily, and that his energy was as usual?

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿欲來相見。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit wants to come and meet him."

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「今拘薩羅王波斯匿安隱快樂，今天及人、阿修羅、揵塔和、羅剎及餘若干身安隱快樂。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Now, King Prasenajit of Kośala is peaceful and happy, and today there are people, asuras, gandharvas, rājas, and certain other bodies who are peaceful and happy.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿若欲來者，自可隨意。」
translation: King Prasenajit of Kośala can come at his own will if he wants to."

source_sentence: 彼時，使人聞佛所說，善受持誦，即從坐起，繞三匝而去。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, the messenger well-acquired, memorized, and recited it, got up from his seat, circled him three times, and departed.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者阿難住世尊後，執拂侍佛。
translation: At the time, Venerable Ānanda was staying behind the Bhagavān, holding his whisk and serving the Buddha.

source_sentence: 使人去後，於是世尊迴顧告曰：「阿難！
translation: After the messenger departed, the Bhagavān then looked back and told him, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝來共詣東向大屋，開窓閉戶，住彼密處。
translation: Come, let's go together to the large east-facing house, open the windows and close the doors, and stay in that secret place.

source_sentence: 今日拘薩羅王波斯匿一心無亂，欲聽受法。」
translation: Today, the king of Kośala Prasenajit is single-minded and unconfused, and he wants to hear and accept the teaching."

source_sentence: 尊者阿難白曰：「唯然。」
translation: Venerable Ānanda said, "Yes, I do."

source_sentence: 於是，世尊將尊者阿難至彼東向大屋，開窓閉戶，密處布座，敷尼師檀，結跏趺坐。
translation: The Bhagavān then took Venerable Ānanda to a large east-facing house, opened the windows and closed the doors, spread out his seat in a secret place, spread out his sitting mat, and sat cross-legged there.

source_sentence: 彼時，使人還詣拘薩羅王波斯匿所，白曰：「天王！
translation: The messenger then returned to King Prasenajit of Kośala and said, "King of gods!

source_sentence: 我已通沙門瞿曇！
translation: I have communicated with the ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇今待天王，唯願天王自當知時。」
translation: The ascetic Gautama is now expecting the king of gods, so may the king of gods himself know when it's time."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿告御者曰：「汝可嚴駕，我今欲往見沙門瞿曇。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit told the royal servant, "You may drive him closely, for I want to go see the ascetic Gautama now."

source_sentence: 御者受教，即便嚴駕。
translation: The royal servant was instructed, and he drove him rigidly.

source_sentence: 爾時，賢及月姉妹與拘薩羅王波斯匿共坐食時，聞今日拘薩羅王波斯匿當往見佛，白曰：「大王！
translation: At the time, Goodness and the sister Yue were sitting with King Kośala Prasenajit as they ate, and when they heard that today King Kośala Prasenajit would go to see the Buddha, they said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 若今往見世尊者，願為我等稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？
translation: If you were to go to see the Bhagavān now, would you bow down before him and ask him about the health and strength of the sages, their well-being and freedom from illness, their ease of rising and standing, and their strength as usual?

source_sentence: 作如是語：『賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』」
translation: They said, 'Good man, do you and your sister Yue bow before the Bhagavān and ask, 'Are you saying that the noble body is strong and healthy, that you are comfortable and have no illness, that you are rising and standing easily, and that your energy is as usual?'"

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿為賢及月姉妹默然而受。
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit accepted it in silence for the sake of Goodness and Sister Yue.

source_sentence: 彼時，御者嚴駕已訖，白曰：「天王！
translation: When the royal guard had finished his rigorous drive, he said, "King of the gods!

source_sentence: 嚴駕已辦，隨天王意。」
translation: Having done so, he followed the king of the gods' wishes."

source_sentence: 時，王聞已，即便乘車，從欝頭隨若出，往至普棘刺林。
translation: After hearing this, the king then took his chariot and left Uddaka and went to the Pratibhāna Forest.

source_sentence: 爾時，普棘刺林門外眾多比丘露地經行，拘薩羅王波斯匿往詣諸比丘所，問曰：「諸賢！
translation: At the time, there were many monks walking in the open outside the entrance to the Prasenajit Grove, and the king of Kośala Prasenajit went to those monks and asked, "Good men!

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇今在何處？
translation: Where is the ascetic Gautama now?

source_sentence: 我欲往見。」
translation: I want to go and see them."

source_sentence: 諸比丘答曰：「大王！
translation: The monks replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 彼東向大屋開窓閉戶，世尊在中，大王欲見者，可詣彼屋，在外住已，謦欬敲戶，世尊聞者，必為開戶。」
translation: That large east-facing house has its windows open and its doors closed, and the Bhagavān is in it. If you want to see it, the king can go to that house, and after staying outside, you will sound the door with your voice and the Bhagavān will open it for you when he hears that."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿即便下車，眷屬圍繞，步往至彼東向大屋，到已住外，謦欬敲戶，世尊聞已，即為開戶，拘薩羅王波斯匿便入彼屋，前詣佛所，白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: King Kośala Prasenajit then got out of his car, surrounded by his retinue, and walked over to that large east-facing house, stayed outside when he arrived, and banged on the door with his voice, and the Bhagavān heard it and opened the door for him.

source_sentence: 賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？」
translation: Good man and sister Yue bowed their heads to the Bhagavān and asked, "Are the noble body strong and healthy, comfortable and without illness, does he rise and live with ease, and does he have his usual strength?"

source_sentence: 世尊問王：「賢及月姉妹更無人使耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān asked the king, "Are there any good men and sister Yue and no one else to serve them?"

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit said, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 當知今日賢及月姉妹我共坐食，聞我今當欲往見佛，便白曰：『大王！
translation: You should know that today, the good man and his sister Yue were sitting here with me, and when they heard that I was going to see the Buddha, they said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 若往見佛者，當為我等稽首世尊！
translation: If you go to see the Buddha, bow down for us, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』
translation: May I ask whether the sage's body is healthy and strong, he is comfortable and free from illness, he lives easily, and his energy remains as usual?'

source_sentence: 故如是白世尊：『賢及月姉妹稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？』
translation: They therefore said to the Bhagavān, 'Good man, do you and your sister Yue present yourselves to the Bhagavān and ask, 'Is your noble body healthy and strong, comfortable and without illness, does it feel easy to get up and go about your life, and does it have the same strength as usual?'

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: Gautama!

source_sentence: 彼賢及月稽首世尊，問訊聖體康強，安快無病，起居輕便，氣力如常耶？」
translation: Did those good men and Yue bow before the Bhagavān and ask, "Are the noble bodies strong and healthy, comfortable and without illness, do they rise and live with ease, and do they have normal energy?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Great king!

source_sentence: 今賢及月姉妹安隱快樂，今天及人、阿修羅、揵塔和、羅剎及餘若干身安隱快樂。」
translation: Now, good man and his sister Yue are peaceful and happy, and today there are people, asuras, gandharvas, rājas, and certain other bodies who are peaceful and happy."

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿與佛共相問訊，却坐一面，白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: Thereupon, the king of Kośala Prasenajit and the Buddha exchanged greetings, withdrew to sit to one side, and said, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 我欲有所問，聽乃敢陳？」
translation: I want to ask a question, but will you dare to tell me?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問者，恣意所問。」
translation: Those who want to ask questions should feel free to do so."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿便問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit then asked, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 我聞沙門瞿曇作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』
translation: I've heard the ascetic Gautama say this, 'It wasn't there in the past, and it won't be there now, if there are other ascetics and priests who know everything and see everything.'

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: Gautama!

source_sentence: 憶如是說耶？」
translation: Do you remember saying this?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我不憶作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』」
translation: I don't recall saying, 'It wasn't there, and it won't be there now, if there are other ascetics and priests who know and see everything.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，鞞留羅大將住在拘薩羅王波斯匿後，執拂拂王，於是拘薩羅王波斯匿迴顧告鞞留羅大將曰：「前日王共大眾坐，誰最前說沙門瞿曇作如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一切知、一切見者。』」
translation: It was then that the Vairocana general was staying behind King Prasenajit and holding a whisk over the king, when King Prasenajit looked back and told the Vairocana general, "The other day, when the king was sitting with the crowd, who was the first to say that the ascetic Gautama said this, 'There was nothing, and there will be nothing, and there is nothing now, if there are any other ascetics or priests who know everything and see everything.'"

source_sentence: 鞞留羅大將答曰：「天王！
translation: The great general Vairocana answered, "King of the gods!

source_sentence: 有想年少吉祥子前作是說。」
translation: A young, imaginative, and auspicious child comes forward and says this."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，告一人曰：「汝往至想年少吉祥子所，作如是語：『拘薩羅王波斯匿呼汝！』」
translation: After hearing this, King Kośala Prasenajit addressed one person, "Go to the young, imaginative, and auspicious son and say, 'King Kośala Prasenajit calls you!'"

source_sentence: 彼人受教，即往想年少吉祥子所，作如是語：「年少！
translation: That person receives the teaching and goes to the place where he thinks of the young, auspicious son and says, "Young man!

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿呼汝。」
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit called to you."

source_sentence: 彼人去後。
translation: That man departed.

source_sentence: 於是，拘薩羅王波斯匿白世尊曰：「沙門瞿曇！
translation: Thereupon, King Prasenajit of Kośala said to the Bhagavān, "Gautama the ascetic!

source_sentence: 頗有異說異受？
translation: Is there a difference in the way it is explained and received?

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇憶所說耶？」
translation: Does the ascetic Gautama recall what he said?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我憶曾如是說：『本無，當不有，今現亦無，若有餘沙門、梵志一時知一切，一時見一切。』
translation: I remember saying, 'It wasn't there in the past, and it won't be there now, if some other ascetic or priest knew everything at once and saw everything at once.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 我憶如是說也。」
translation: I remember teaching it this way."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「沙門瞿曇所說如師，沙門瞿曇所說如善師。
translation: After hearing this, the king of Kośala Prasenajit praised him, saying, "The ascetic Gautama teaches like a teacher, and the ascetic Gautama teaches like a good teacher.

source_sentence: 欲更有所問，聽我問耶？」
translation: Do you want to ask more questions and hear me ask them?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問，恣意所問。」
translation: You may ask as many questions as you like."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit asked, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，為有勝如、有差別耶？」
translation: Are these four kinds, bhadra, priest, householder, and worker, superior or different?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別也。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "There are four kinds of people: bhadrīs, priests, householders, and workers, which have superiority and distinctions.

source_sentence: 剎利、梵志種，此於人間為最上德，居士、工師種，此於人間為下德也。
translation: The bodhisattva and priest types are the highest virtues among humans, and the householder and worker types are the lowest virtues among humans.

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，是謂勝如、是謂差別。」
translation: These are the four kinds, bhadra, priest, householder, and worker, which are called superior, and these are called distinctions."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「沙門瞿曇所說如師，沙門瞿曇所說如善師。」
translation: After hearing this, King Prasenajit of Kośala praised him, saying, "What the ascetic Gautama says is like a teacher, and what the ascetic Gautama says is like a good teacher."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit said, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 我不但問於現世義，亦復欲問於後世義，聽我問耶？」
translation: Not only do I want to ask about the meaning of the present life, but I also want to ask about the meaning of the future life, so will you listen to my questions?"

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān told them, "Great king!

source_sentence: 欲問，恣意所問。」
translation: You may ask as many questions as you like."

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿問曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The king of Kośala Prasenajit asked, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別於後世耶？」
translation: Are there four kinds of bodhisattvas, priests, householders, and workers, which are superior and which are different in the afterlife?"

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，此有勝如、有差別謂後世也。
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "There are four kinds of bodhisattvas, priests, householders, and workers, which are superior and have distinctions that refer to the afterlife.

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，若成就此五斷支，必得善師如來、無所著、正盡覺，必得可意，無不可意，亦於長夜得義饒益，安隱快樂。
translation: If these four kinds of bodhisattvas, priests, householders, and workers accomplish these five limbs of elimination, they will surely attain the status of good teacher, tathāgata, unattached, and fully awakened, and they will surely attain something agreeable and nothing that's not agreeable, as well as obtain meaningful benefit and peace and happiness in the long night.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子信著如來，根生定立，無能奪者，謂沙門、梵志、天及魔、梵及餘世間，是謂第一斷支。
translation: Well-versed noble disciples who are faithfully attached to the Tathāgata and whose faculties are firmly established, and there's no one who can take them away, namely, ascetics, priests, gods, Māra, Brahmā, and the rest of the world, this is called the first limb of elimination.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子少病無病，成就等食道，不熱不冷，正樂不諍，謂食飲消、正安隱消，是謂第二斷支。
translation: The well-versed noble disciple has few illnesses and no illnesses, achieves a path of equal food, isn't hot or cold, and has the right pleasure and lack of strife, which is defined as the elimination of food and drink and the elimination of right tranquility, which is called the second limb of elimination.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子無諂無誑、質直，現如真世尊及諸梵行，是謂第三斷支。
translation: The well-versed noble disciple who is without deceit or guile and is straightforward and who behaves like the true Bhagavān and the other religious practitioners is the third limb of elimination.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子常行精進，斷惡不善，修諸善法，恒自起意，專一堅固，為諸善本，不捨方便，是謂第四斷支。
translation: The well-versed noble disciple always conducts himself with energy, stops what's bad and unskillful, cultivates good qualities, always motivates himself, is focused and resolute, makes roots of goodness, and doesn't abandon skillful means, which is called the fourth limb of elimination.

source_sentence: 復次，大王！
translation: "Furthermore, Great King!

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子修行智慧，觀興衰法，得如此智，聖慧明達，分別曉了，以正盡苦，是謂第五斷支。
translation: The well-versed noble disciple cultivates wisdom, observes the law of rise and decline, attains this knowledge, and attains insight from noble wisdom, discerns and comprehends it, and correctly ends suffering with it, which is called the fifth limb of elimination.

source_sentence: 此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，彼若成就此五斷支，必得善師如來、無所著、正盡覺，必得可意，無不可意，亦於長夜得義饒益，安隱快樂，此有四種，剎利、梵志、居士、工師，是謂勝如、是謂差別於後世也。」
translation: If they accomplish these five limiting factors, they'll surely attain the good teacher, the tathāgata, the lack of attachment, and right ascertainment, and they'll surely attain agreeable and undesirable [views], as well as meaningful benefit and peace and happiness in the long night.

source_sentence: 拘薩羅王波斯匿聞已，歎曰：「沙門瞿曇所說如師，沙門瞿曇所說如善師。

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，無量善色惡色，彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第四除處。』
translation: He has an internal conception of formlessness, which outwardly appears as countless good and bad forms, and he thinks, 'This is the fourth place of removal.'

source_sentence: 「復次，比丘！
translation: "Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，青青色，青見青光。
translation: "Internal conceptions of formlessness have an outward appearance that's bluish, and they see a bluish glow.

source_sentence: 猶如青水華，青青色，青見青光。
translation: It's like a blue watery bloom that's blue in color and sees a blue light.

source_sentence: 猶如成就波羅[木*奈]衣，熟擣磨碾，光色悅澤，青青色，青見青光。
translation: It's like the accomplishment of a pārājika [wood*nai] robe that's ripened, worn, and polished, which has a lustrous appearance and a blue-green color, and it sees a blue light.

source_sentence: 如是，比丘！
translation: Monks, it's like this!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，青青色，青見青光，無量無量，淨意潤意，樂不憎惡。
translation: "He has an internal perception of formlessness, which is an outward-looking form that's bluish-cyan in color and has a bluish glow that's measureless and immeasurable, which purifies his mind and nourishes his thoughts and makes him happy and not hateful.

source_sentence: 彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第五除處。』
translation: He removes known form and views past form and thinks, 'This is the fifth place of removal.'

source_sentence: 復次，比丘！
translation: Again, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，黃黃色，黃見黃光。
translation: "Internal conceptions of formlessness, which appear as form, are yellowish-yellow, and yellow-hued, and they see yellow light.

source_sentence: 猶如頻頭歌羅華，黃黃色，黃見黃光。
translation: It's like the vindhu kalaviṅka, which has yellow color and sees yellow light.

source_sentence: 猶如成就波羅[木*奈]衣，熟擣磨碾，光色悅澤，黃黃色，黃見黃光。
translation: It's like the polo[mu*na] robe that's been worn, broken up, and polished, which has a pleasant yellow color and a yellowish glow.

source_sentence: 如是，比丘！
translation: Thus, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，黃黃色，黃見黃光，無量無量，淨意潤意，樂不憎惡。
translation: "He has an internal perception of formlessness, which is an outward-looking form, yellow-yellow in color, yellow-visible as yellow light, immeasurable and limitless, which purifies his mind and nourishes his thoughts and makes him happy and not hateful.

source_sentence: 彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第六除處。』
translation: He removes known form and views past form and thinks, 'This is the sixth place of removal.'

source_sentence: 「復次，比丘！
translation: "Furthermore, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，赤赤色，赤見赤光。
translation: "Internal conceptions of formlessness have an appearance of form, red-red color, and red-visible red light.

source_sentence: 猶如加尼歌羅華，赤赤色，赤見赤光。
translation: It's like the garland of the kanakara flower, which is red-red in color and sees red light.

source_sentence: 猶如成就波羅[木*奈]衣，熟擣磨碾，光色悅澤，赤赤色，赤見赤光。
translation: It's like the perfection of a pārājika [wood*nai] robe that's ripened, rewound, and polished, which has a lustrous appearance and a red-red color and a red-red light that's seen.

source_sentence: 如是，比丘！
translation: Monks, it's like this!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色，赤赤色，赤見赤光，無量無量，淨意潤意，樂不憎惡。
translation: "He has an internal perception of formlessness, which is the outward appearance of form, red-red color, red-visible red light, immeasurable and limitless, which purifies his mind and nourishes his thoughts and makes him happy and not hateful.

source_sentence: 彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第七除處。』
translation: He removes known form and views past it, and he thinks, 'This is the seventh place of removal.'

source_sentence: 復次，比丘！
translation: Again, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色白，白色、白見、白光；猶如大白，白色、白見、白光；猶如成就波羅[木*奈]衣熟擣磨碾、光色悅澤白，白色、白見、白光。
translation: When there's no internal perception of form, it has a white appearance, a white color, a white view, and a white light; it's like a great white color, a white color, a white view, and a white light; it's like the accomplishment of a paulownia [wood*nai] robe that's ripened, polished, and shiny with a pleasant white color, and it's white, white in view, and white in light.

source_sentence: 如是，比丘！
translation: Thus, monks!

source_sentence: 內無色想，外觀色白，白色、白見、白光，無量無量淨意、潤意，樂不憎惡。
translation: He has an internal perception of formlessness, an external form that's white, white in color, white in view, and white in radiance, and an immeasurable and immeasurably pure and nurturing mind that's pleasant and not hateful.

source_sentence: 彼色除已知、除已見，作如是想：『是謂第八除處。』
translation: They see form except as known and except as seen, and they think, 'This is the eighth place of removal.'

source_sentence: 眾生如是樂除處意解者，變易有異。
translation: When sentient beings thus understand the mind that's happy with the place of removal, there are differences in their transformations.

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子如是觀則厭彼，厭彼已，尚不欲第一，況復下賤？
translation: Well-versed noble disciples thus observe them, then they become disillusioned with them, and after becoming disillusioned with them, they still don't want to be the first, so how could they be inferior?

source_sentence: 「復次，有十一切處。
translation: "Furthermore, there are the ten universal positions.

source_sentence: 云何為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 有比丘無量地處修一，思惟上下諸方不二，無量水處，無量火處，無量風處，無量青處，無量黃處，無量赤處，無量白處，無量空處，無量識處第十修一，思惟上下諸方不二。
translation: "Suppose a monk cultivates oneness in measureless stages, contemplates that the higher and lower realms are not two, and he cultivates oneness in measureless water, measureless fire, measureless wind, measureless green, measureless yellow, measureless red, measureless white, measureless air, and measureless consciousness in the tenth place, contemplates that the higher and lower realms are not two.

source_sentence: 眾生如是樂一切處意解者，變易有異。
translation: When sentient beings thus enjoy the understanding of all places, their transformations are different.

source_sentence: 多聞聖弟子如是觀則厭彼，厭彼已，尚不欲第一，況復下賤？
translation: Well-versed noble disciples who thus observe them become disillusioned with them, and after becoming disillusioned with them, they still don't want to be the first, so how could they be inferior?

source_sentence: 是謂第一清淨說，施設最第一，謂我無、我不有，及為彼證故，施設於道，是謂第一外依見處、最依見處，謂度一切色想，乃至得非有想非無想處成就遊。
translation: This is called the first pure teaching, the supreme designation, which is that the self is absent and the self doesn't exist, and the designation of the path for their realization, which is the first external basis of views and the most basis of views, which is to free oneself from all perceptions of form and to attain the accomplishment of the state of neither perception nor non-perception.

source_sentence: 是謂於現法中第一，求趣至涅槃，於現法中最施設涅槃，謂六更樂處生、滅、味、離、慧見如真，及為彼證故，施設於道。
translation: This is called the first in the present life, seeking to attain nirvāṇa, and the best-designated nirvāṇa in the present life, which is the six more pleasant states of arising, ceasing, taste, separation, and insight as true, and the path that's designed for their realization.

source_sentence: 「復次，有四斷。
translation: "Furthermore, there are four ways to end it.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 有斷樂遲，有斷樂速，有斷苦遲，有斷苦速，於中若有斷樂遲者，是樂遲故，說下賤。
translation: "If there's delay in ending pleasure, speed in ending pleasure, delay in ending suffering, and speed in ending suffering, then if there's delay in ending pleasure among them, it's because of the delay in pleasure that it's said to be low.

source_sentence: 於中若有斷樂欲，若有人習此法初無厭足，若復有人習飲酒者初無厭足，若復有人修習睡眠初無厭足，是謂比丘若人有習此三法者初無厭足，亦復不能至滅盡處。
translation: If there's someone who stops longing, if there's someone who cultivates this thing and doesn't get tired of it in the beginning, if there's someone who cultivates drinking alcohol and doesn't get tired of it in the beginning, and if there's someone who cultivates sleeping and doesn't get tired of it in the beginning, this is called a monk who cultivates these three things and doesn't get tired of them in the beginning, but also doesn't reach the place of total cessation.

source_sentence: 是故諸比丘常當捨離此三法不親近之，如是諸比丘當作是學。」
translation: Therefore, monks must always abandon these three things and not become intimate with them; thus, monks should train in this way."

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, the monks rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 供養、三善根　　三痛、三覆露　相法、三不覺　　愛敬、無厭足第一得經第四竟(一千三百七十一字)中阿含經卷第五十九(一萬七百七十二字)(第五後誦)「若有斷樂速者，此斷樂速故，此斷亦說下賤。
translation: Making offerings, the three good roots, the three pains, the three coverings, the three unawarenesses, the love and respect, and the unsatisfactory completion of the fourth sutra (1,371 words), the middle-level Āgama sūtras, vol. 59 (17,772 words) (recited after the fifth), "If there's someone who's quick to end pleasure, it's because they're quick to end pleasure that this ending is also described as lowly.

source_sentence: 於中若有斷苦遲者，此斷苦遲故，此斷亦說下賤。
translation: If there's someone who's slow to end suffering, it's because they're slow to end suffering that this ending is also described as lowly.

source_sentence: 於中若有斷苦速者，此斷苦速故，此斷非廣布、不流布，乃至天人亦不稱廣布，我斷廣布流布，乃至天人亦稱廣布。
translation: If there's someone who stops suffering quickly, and it's stopped because suffering is stopped quickly, that stoppage isn't widely distributed or disseminated, and even celestials don't call it widely distributed; I stop the widespread distribution and dissemination, and even celestials call it widely distributed.

source_sentence: 云何我斷廣布流布，乃至天人亦稱廣布？
translation: How have I stopped the widespread distribution and dissemination, even if a celestial being also calls it widespread?

source_sentence: 謂八支正道，正見乃至正定為八，是謂我斷廣布流布，乃至天人亦稱廣布。
translation: The eightfold right path, which are the eightfold right view and even right concentration, are called the eightfold dissemination of my cutting off and spreading, even if gods and humans also call it spreading.

source_sentence: 我如是，諸沙門、梵志虛偽妄言，不善不真，實誣謗於我，彼實有眾生施設斷壞，沙門瞿曇無所施設，彼實有眾生施設斷壞。
translation: Thus, ascetics and priests who falsely claim that they're not good or true really misrepresent me, and they really have sentient beings whose claims are cut off, and the ascetic Gautama has no claims, and they really have sentient beings whose claims are cut off.

source_sentence: 若此無我不如是說，彼如來於現法中斷知一切，得息、止、滅、涅槃。」
translation: If this absence of self isn't explained like this, then the Tathāgata interrupts the knowledge of all things in the present life and attains calmness, cessation, extinction, and nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 佛說如是。
translation: Thus did the Buddha speak.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: Those monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.
